channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘Birthright Citizenship’ Is A Feudal Relic That Has No Place In America
item.description: We used to base citizenship on consent, not birth. In an era of mass immigration, it’s time to get back to that older understanding.

item.title: Leavitt accuses CNN reporter of trying to 'push narratives' during heated White House exchange
item.description: White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt sparked a heated exchange with CNN's Kaitlan Collins over Trump's inflation claims and economic messaging...

item.title: Grand jury refuses to charge Letitia James as DOJ keeps pushing for indictment

item.description: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem defiantly defended the Trump administration's hard-line immigration policies on Thursday during a House commit...

item.title: Senators consider stopping their pay in future shutdown
item.description: Mr. Bennet introduced this legislation in 2010, he said, and since then, the amount spent on lobbying and the number of lobbyists have only grown.

item.title: OpenAI and Disney just ended the ‘war’ between AI and Hollywood with their $1 billion Sora deal—and OpenAI made itself ‘indispensable,’ expert says
item.description: “Google has YouTube. OpenAI now has the Magic Kingdom,” copyright expert Matthew Sag said.

item.title: It’s the Incentives, Stupid

item.title: Clarence Thomas presses Dem operative Marc Elias in high-stakes Supreme Court clash
item.description: Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas questioned lawyer Marc Elias about campaign finance law limits on coordinated political spending between parties...

item.title: ‘Creativity is the new productivity’: Bob Iger on why Disney chose to be ‘aggressive,’ adding OpenAI as a $1 billion partner
item.description: "We'd rather participate in the rather dramatic growth, rather than just watching it happen and essentially being disrupted by it," Iger told CNBC.

item.title: Doha Is the New Paris
item.description: Tucker Carlson finds an alluring alternative to the United States.

item.title: Congress Gets Something Right
item.description: The House-passed National Defense Authorization Act is an antidote to the administration’s unserious National Security Strategy.

item.title: RFK Jr. and Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy had a pull-up competition at Reagan to announce Trump’s $1 billion plan for healthy airport upgrades
item.description: Officials were vague about what these upgrades could include.

item.title: On Obamacare, Trump Already Showed Republicans the Way
item.description: Senate Republicans should quit trying to expand it.

item.title: A DOJ That Still Chases ‘Russian Hackers’ Will Never Reckon With Russiagate
item.description: The DOJ is prosecuting the fruits of a hoax on one hand and claiming to expose the architects of that hoax on the other.

item.title: Senate rejects dueling health care bills as enhanced Obamacare subsidy cliff looms

item.title: Leftist Wisconsin AG Is Failing To Fix The Problem He Pounded His Opponent On
item.description: Attorney General Josh Kaul won his first term on a manufactured rape kit-testing backlog scandal. Now he has the same problem and more.

item.title: Bob Iger says Disney’s $1 billion deal with OpenAI is an ‘opportunity, not a threat’: ‘We’d rather participate than be disrupted by it’
item.description: The three-year deal will bring more than 200 Disney characters to Sora.

item.title: OpenAI aims to silence concerns it is falling behind in the AI race with release of new model GPT-5.2
item.description: OpenAI said its new model outperforms those from rivals Google and Anthropic across a wide range of evaluations.

item.description: ‘I want to be able to have one thing left that is sacred to our family.’

item.title: Returning To ‘Times New Roman,’ The State Department Learns From Cracker Barrel’s Mistakes
item.description: It would be foolish to assume the aesthetics we surround ourselves with have no effect on how we perceive the world.

item.title: US set to seize tens of millions in Venezuelan oil after tanker interception, White House says
item.description: White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt confirms U.S. plans to seize oil from Venezuelan tanker captured off Venezuela's coast on Wednesday.
